{"step_by_step_thinking": "The splenic artery originates from the celiac trunk. Ligating the splenic artery at its origin will result in hypoperfusion of the arteries that branch off from the splenic artery. The left gastric artery, gastroduodenal artery, and left gastroepiploic artery are all branches of the splenic artery. The common hepatic artery is not directly affected by ligating the splenic artery. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Left gastroepiploic artery.", "answer_choice": "C"}
